SENT.plain: PURPOSE: To report the rare occurrence of conjunctival ulceration in a patient with Behcet's disease
A 35 year old "BehÃ§et's suspect" on azathioprine presented to the ophthalmic emergency room with a painful ulceration involving the inferior palpebral conjunctiva of her left eye
RESULTS: The ulcer responded to treatment with topical steroids and healed without scarring
CONCLUSIONS: Conjunctival ulceration is not a common manifestation of Behcet's disease
Its occurrence during maintenance therapy with azathioprine in a patient with Behcets could be either incidental or indicate inadequate immunosuppression
